Initial release of simplified 20x version of this existing FedRAMP policy.

front_matter.purpose:
This set of requirements and recommendations converts the existing FedRAMP Incident Communications Procedures (https://www.fedramp.gov/resources/documents/Continuous_Monitoring_Playbook.pdf) to the simpler FedRAMP 20x style and clarifies the expectations for FedRAMP 20x.

The only notable change from the default Rev5 Incident Communications Procedures for 20x is the addition of a recommendation that incident information be made available in both human-readable and machine-readable formats.

base.application: These requirements and recommendations apply ALWAYS to ALL FedRAMP Authorized cloud services based on the current Effective Date(s) and Overall Applicability of this document.
base.name: Requirements & Recommendations

requirements.statement: Providers MUST responsibly report _incidents_ to FedRAMP within 1 hour of identification by sending an email to fedramp_security@fedramp.gov or fedramp_security@gsa.gov.
requirements.name: Incident Reporting to FedRAMP

requirements.statement: Providers MUST responsibly report _incidents_ to all _agency_ customers within 1 hour of identification using the _incident_ communications points of contact provided by each _agency_ customer.
requirements.name: Incident Reporting to Agencies

requirements.statement: Providers MUST responsibly report _incidents_ to CISA within 1 hour of identification if the incident is confirmed or suspected to be the result of an attack vector listed at https://www.cisa.gov/federal-incident-notification-guidelines#attack-vectors-taxonomy, following the CISA Federal Incident Notification Guidelines at https://www.cisa.gov/federal-incident-notification-guidelines, by using the CISA Incident Reporting System at https://myservices.cisa.gov/irf.
requirements.name: Incident Reporting to CISA

requirements.statement: Providers MUST update _all necessary parties_, including at least FedRAMP, CISA (if applicable), and all _agency_ customers, at least once per calendar day until the _incident_ is resolved and recovery is complete.
requirements.name: Incident Updates

requirements.statement: Providers MUST make _incident_ report information available in their secure FedRAMP repository (such as USDA Connect) or _trust center_.
requirements.name: Incident Report Availability

requirements.statement: Providers MUST NOT irresponsibly disclose specific sensitive information about _incidents_ that would _likely_ increase the impact of the _incident_, but MUST disclose sufficient information for informed risk-based decision-making to _all necessary parties_.
requirements.name: Responsible Disclosure

requirements.statement: Providers MUST provide a final report once the _incident_ is resolved and recovery is complete that describes at least:
requirements.name: Final Incident Report

requirements.statement: Providers SHOULD use automated mechanisms for reporting incidents and providing updates to all necessary parties (including CISA).
requirements.name: Automated Reporting

requirements.statement: Providers SHOULD make _incident_ report information available in consistent human-readable and _machine-readable_ formats.
requirements.name: Human-Readable and Machine-Readable Formats
